questions.a: Do you prefer a strict separation between work and rest?
questions.b: Do you feel comfortable mixing work and leisure throughout the day?

questions.a: Are you more motivated by long-term success, even if it requires a slower pace?
questions.b: Do you prefer to work hard at short-term goals, even if it means burning out occasionally?

questions.a: When you have a lot going on, do you tend to take a step back and recalibrate?
questions.b: Do you push to get a task done, regardless of your stress level?

questions.a: Do you often find yourself revising your work until it's perfect, even if it means missing a deadline?
questions.b: Are you satisfied with ‘good enough’ results as long as you achieve your goal?

questions.a: Do you feel uncomfortable when you overlook details, even the smallest ones?
questions.b: Are minor flaws okay if the bigger picture is okay?

questions.a: Do you prefer to make a thorough plan before starting a task?
questions.b: Do you like to start working right away and make adjustments as you go?

questions.a: Do you prefer to stick to a planned schedule for the day?
questions.b: Do you enjoy adjusting your day to fit your mood at the moment?

questions.a: Do you feel more productive when your work is structured and routine?
questions.b: Do you succeed when things are flexible and can change unexpectedly?

questions.a: Do you feel anxious when things don't go as planned?
questions.b: Do you see sudden change as an opportunity for creativity?

questions.a: Do you prefer working alone because it helps you focus?
questions.b: Do you feel more energized when you collaborate with others?

questions.a: Do you like solving problems independently?
questions.b: Do you prefer brainstorming solutions with others?

questions.a: Do you feel exhausted after a lot of social interaction?
questions.b: Does socializing boost your energy after a long day?

questions.a: Are you able to focus on your work regardless of your emotional state?
questions.b: Does your productivity often depend on your mood or emotions?

questions.a: Do you tend to suppress your emotions to focus on work?
questions.b: Do you need to express or process your emotions to be more productive?

questions.a: Are you usually calm and steady even in stressful situations?
questions.b: Do you often feel emotionally overwhelmed during stressful situations?

questions.a: Do you feel most satisfied when you achieve a specific goal?
questions.b: Do you enjoy the journey more than the destination, regardless of the outcome?

questions.a: Do you often set measurable goals?
questions.b: Do you prefer things to progress naturally without strict goals?

questions.a: Do you stay focused on your long-term goals even if they take a long time to achieve?
questions.b: Do you tend to focus on short-term wins?
